scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You then acknowledged the team's feelings and opened the floor for discussion. Now, Monica sighs and says, 'Even if we discuss our concerns, the time isn't going to magically expand.' Bob, rubbing his temples, mutters, 'This is just going to be a disaster waiting to happen.' You then opened the floor for suggestions but also pushed the team to continue working. Bob, feeling the pressure, stands up and paces around the room, and Monica crosses her arms tightly.
scenes.description: Monica, with a hint of sarcasm, says, 'Well, since we have all the time in the world, why don't we just brainstorm some more?'

options.text: I get your point, Monica. Let's take a moment to breathe and then focus on what we can control.
options.analysis: You acknowledged Monica's sarcasm and suggested a momentary pause, showing high emotional perception and empathy.

options.text: I understand it's frustrating, but if we keep a positive mindset and work efficiently, we might pull through.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay positive and focused, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: If sarcasm is your way of contributing, Monica, maybe we should just get back to work.
options.analysis: You addressed Monica's sarcasm directly and pushed the team to continue working, showing moderate emotional perception and self-regulation.
